thread.title: The Earth-like planets we have found may not be like Earth
thread.title_full: The Earth-like planets we have found may not be like Earth

title: The Earth-like planets we have found may not be like Earth
text:
Planet The Earth-like planets we have found may not be like Earth We have found plenty of apparently "Earth-like" worlds beyond our solar system, but that does not mean they are living worlds like ours Share on Facebook 20 February 2017 
There are more planets in our galaxy than there are stars, says science writer and astrophysicist Adam Becker . He explains what these "exoplanets" are like to BBC Earth's Melissa Hogenboom and Michael Marshall, with help from the animators at Pomona Pictures . 
Join over six million BBC Earth fans by liking us on Facebook , or follow us on Twitter and Instagram .
